description: From Middle English forthy, from Old English forþȳ, for þȳ [þe] (“because [that]”), forþon (“because, since”), from for + þȳ, þon (“by that, therefore”), instrumental case of þæt (“that”); Cognate with Yola farthoo (“why”), Old Norse fyrir því (at) (Danish & Norwegian fordi (“because”), Swedish för att). More at for, the, that.

examples: Forthy as now, I purpose for to wryte... Forthy as now schortlie to conclude.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) For this, for this reason; on this account.
